data.title: Support for tab window containers on single workspaces as in IntelliJ

<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: win10

In markdown preview, when there is a link which has a Href attribute  using "Https", an error like the title come up:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17958546/24199591/27c177d0-0f45-11e7-9411-3e7fd50fe696.png)
But if I change it to Http, the error will disappear.
There is a small [sample](https://github.com/928PJY/vscode-markdown-Test), looking forward your response.

data.title: Java auto rebuild support for Spring Boot hot swapping
data.body:
Since vscode now has Java language support, I'm trying to make a Java Spring Boot web app to see if it's ready for lightweight Java development.
However, I can't find any option to enable hot swapping -- auto rebuild when file changes, which means I have to recompile and hit refresh every time I make a  change. 

It probably a feature powered by IDE than command line and in Intellij IDEA I've figured out how to enable this feature, 
1. add `spring boot devtools` to  pom.xml
2. enable `Compiler->Build project automatically`
3.  enable `compiler.automake.allow.when.app.running` in `registry`

PS.
I'm a Java Spring newbie.

data.title: PowerShell integrated Console - version no.
data.body:
Description
-------------

I can't import the PowerShell module [SSASCMDLETS](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh213141.aspx) from SQL Server Analytics Service.

Steps to Reproduce:
-----------------------
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 64x

1. Install SQL Server with Analytics Service
2. Run Import-Module [SSASCMDLETS](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh213141.aspx)

Results in:
-----------
``` powershell
PS C:\myfolder> Import-Module SQLASCMDLETS
Import-Module : The current Windows PowerShell host is: 'Visual Studio Code Host' (version 0.10.1). The module 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SQL
Server\110\Tools\PowerShell\Modules\SQLASCMDLETS\SQLASCMDLETS.psd1' requires a minimum Windows PowerShell host version of '1.0' to run.
At line:1 char:1
+ Import-Module SQLASCMDLETS
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (C:\Program File...LASCMDLETS.psd1:String) [Import-Module], InvalidOperationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : Modules_InsufficientPowerShellHostVersion,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand

PS C:\myfolder>
```

The PSVersionTable looks OK:
``` powershell
PS C:\myfolder> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.0.10586.117
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.10586.117
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1


PS C:\myfolder>
```

data.title: Interaction with JSON Schema project?
data.body:
Hi VSCode team!

It's great to see you support JSON Schema out of the box.
I also discovered you use JSON Schema as part of your configuration files.

I'm part of the team working on JSON Schema. Is anyone from MS interested in helping shape the future of the specification? If so, let's open a dialogue!

Currently it's a pretty small team, and I'd like to rally support from a few of the big companies that are using or might be interested in JSON Schema. We can push it through to RFC together. =]

data.title: Can't focus 3rd editor pane from terminal with keyboard
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

I quite often have three editor panes open. If keyboard focus is on the integrated terminal I can focus editors 1 and 2 using `ctrl+1` or `ctrl+2`, but I can't focus editor 3 with `ctrl+3`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Split Code into three editor panes (I usually hit `ctrl+1`, `ctrl+2`, `ctrl+3` to set this up quickly)
2. Open the integrated terminal.
3. Ensure integrated terminal has keyboard focus
4. Press `ctrl+3`. Focus will stay in terminal.
5. Press `ctrl+1` or `ctrl+2`. Focus will switch to respective editor pane

data.title: emment fix issue #22923
data.body: Fix issue with emment on ! and a where if you try to create another emmet, cursor just bounces around

data.title: Test: Surface new Exception DAP in UI
data.body:
Test for #22078:

- [x] any os - @isidorn
- [x] any os - @dbaeumer 

Complexity: 1 

Debug adapter protocol introduced new request for retrieving exception information about a thrown exception that is now surfaced in exception widget (Peek UI).

Currently only **node-debug** ('legacy' and 'inspector') and **chrome-debug** support this request.

Verify:
1. Exception widget appears on exception thrown.
2. Handled and unhandled exceptions produce different error messages ('handled exception has occurred' vs 'unhandled exception has occurred')
3. Stacktrace is always shown.
4. For debug adapters that do not support the new protocol request the VS Code debugger UI falls back to the previous behaviour: same peek UI but no stacktrace and no 'handled' or 'unhandled' information.

data.title: Test: Output appending improvements
data.body:
- [x] any os - @kieferrm
- [x] any os - @sandy081 

As per #22804 we have made improvements in how we are appending content to the output channels. Verify:
* All output channels behave as before and that the output select dropdown nicely reflects the currently opened output
* You can create / delete new output channels from an extension and send output to that channel
* When there is too much output we show the last recieved output and stop showing the oldest
* You can spam the output from an extension and vscode will not crash (though it might be unresponsive for a couple of seconds due to JSON parseing and sending)

data.title: [Feature request] Capability to open old version of file in Git side bar
data.body:
There are currently two options available which are displayed after right-clicking at a file in Git side bar:

1. Open Change (the comparison of the old and the new versions)
2. Open File (the new version of the file)

It is requested to have the third option: Open Old File (the old version of the file).

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|javadebugger|donjayamanne|0.0.2|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|output-colorizer|IBM|0.0.11|
|tabsanity|jedmao|0.0.9|
|docomment|k--kato|0.0.14|
|vscode-rust|kalitaalexey|0.3.10|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|java|redhat|0.0.13|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.4.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---
The problems panel is still showing problems for a file that has been deleted from disk.

![probs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19817004/24196030/52af5426-0eb9-11e7-8dbb-54758e2422f0.PNG)
![fis](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19817004/24196037/5a3e256e-0eb9-11e7-9d4f-8afcaeb98ce3.PNG)

Notice that there's no test.cs in the second picture.

If I click on a problem to open the file I get a file not found error as expected.

![err](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19817004/24196082/8c9fa97e-0eb9-11e7-801e-b484273daf70.PNG)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file with errors in some language that produces problems (I've only tried C#).

2. Delete the file (through VS Code or Explorer, I've reproduced it with both).

3. See that the problems reported from that file are still showing in the problems pane.

data.title: New Insiders Build Crashing After A While (And Immediately after Inserting an <a> tag)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Since updating to the latest version this morning, the performance of the insiders build has been degrading over usage time. It works perfectly on startup, but after a while, when I type something like `<div class=` it starts to become unresponsive.

After a little while longer, the program completely crashes and I am given a popup box asking me to reload the page or wait until it responds.

I've checked the task manager on my computer and there is nothing causing any bottleneck on my ram or cpu and all other programs that I am running are still performing the same as they were yesterday.

EDIT: Note: It seems to happen every time I try to create an anchor tag, so maybe it is something to do with the intellisense autocompletion as I get to type 'a' and then it crashes.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider commit: 32942fd950cf2ffe19c44f944170014704b4fd2c
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VsCode Insiders
2. Wait for a while, and the performance will start to degrade when using normally
3. After an unknown amount of time, the program will completely crash and have to be restarted

data.title: Feature Request: Show failed lookup path for not found modules & more
data.body: This is a feature request I experienced that typescript's ts-config is somehow very difficult to debug - and I spend some nights to get understand how the resolution thing works. This is however typescript related, but what can do vscode better? **Current very serious problems:** - I don't know which tsconfig file was used for the workspace - especially if you have nested packages - even if it is always the root one - It must be explicitly showed somewhere - I learn a lot about type acquisition - but I never know what it acquire. It were very helpful if vscode could provide the list of acquired files. I don't know until now how it exactly, and to be honest I have no clue how I can figure this out. Somewhere I read about the "global.d.ts" to include - It never worked - only the node_modules/@types folder was affected. - When I experiment with the tsconfig I never know what's the typescript server is doing after a change. Sometimes it reloads sometimes not or after an unknown time. Because this is the case, it breaks me my last leg to at least get a clue how my config changes affects - Show failed lookup path for not found modules - How I said at the beginning it is very difficult to debug the module/type resolution part, the only information I get is "module not found" - it were so much better if at least the failedLookup list were showed in the problem entry - it would at least give me a clue if I'm on the right road Please, please improve at least some those things, It's just so much time I waste until now to just get my project work. (I use a complex webpack configuration with ts-code, however I don't mention here any webpack related things, they are general issues) --- **Appendix** The only help from vscode I currently seen was: Sometimes. Very rarely. I never know when (after a restart and waiting a minute or so). I got this little error marker there if I add a not existing file property array (not tested with other config props). It hint's that the "notexists" file not exists. This is correct, but how I said, I never know when it's appear and when it's appear It's very small to recognise it.

data.title: INSERT key doesn't work
data.body:
In most editors, the INSERT key will toggle insert/overwrite.

You may think nobody actually uses that, but it's a standard feature in practically every text-editor since the dawn of time, and it does have it's uses.

Typically the cursor changes from a vertical line to a block when overwrite is toggled on.

data.title: Focus peek window on creation
data.body:
I _love_ the peek window. It's pretty much the best thing ever.

I would love it ever so slightly more if VSCode would auto-focus it and insert the cursor where it belongs. e.g. if I clicked "peek definition", the cursor should be on the definition of what I peeked. 

This idea seems so obvious I can't believe it's not part of the default implementation, but I know you guys have your reasons for doing things.  

If there is such a reason, could this at least be made a setting?

Thanks guys!

data.title: Execute node.js application in external terminal throws error.
data.body:
I have an old app in node.js.  This application runs on external terminal with this `launch.json` configuration:

```json
{
    // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible Node.js debug attributes.
    // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
    // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "console": "externalTerminal"
        },
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Attach to Process",
            "port": 5858
        }
    ]
}
```
But when I have updated to vscode version 1.8, the application does not run anymore.
It runs fine on integrated terminal, but not in external.  I need it runs on external terminal.

I have tried to set this vscode settings with no luck:
```json
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Windows\\sysnative\\cmd.exe",
    //"terminal.external.windowsExec": "C:/Windows/System32/cmd.exe"
    "terminal.external.windowsExec": "%COMSPEC%"    
```

I have asked this same with screenshot on stackoverflow:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42905423/vscode-1-10-2-cannot-launch-debug-target-in-terminal

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install vscode 1.8 and execute the application (F5) in external terminal.  It runs fine.
2. Install vscode 1.10.2 (last) and execute the application (F5) in external terminal.  It throws an error:
`Cannot launch debug target in terminal (Cannot convert undefined or null to object).`

data.title: [Insiders] Intelli Sense fails for TypeScript
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider (Commit 32942fd950... from 2017-03-22T07:11:40)
- OS Version: Windows Server 2008 R2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Visual Studio Code Insiders
2. Open TypeScript file
3. Try to get Intelli Sense information for a variable
4. You only get a list of "known" variables but not type specific Intelli Sense

Output-Tab shows the following issue:
```
[Error - 9:18:11 AM] 'quickinfo' request failed with error.
Error processing request. Mismatched request id, expected undefined, actual 60
Error: Mismatched request id, expected undefined, actual 60
    at Object.resetRequest (c:\Entwicklung\<Project>\node_modules\typescript\lib\cancellationToken.js:57:27)
    at IOSession.Session.resetCurrentRequest (c:\Entwicklung\<Project>\node_modules\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:73291:40)
    at IOSession.Session.executeWithRequestId (c:\Entwicklung\<Project>\node_modules\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:73299:26)
    at IOSession.Session.executeCommand (c:\Entwicklung\<Project>\node_modules\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:73305:33)
    at IOSession.Session.onMessage (c:\Entwicklung\<Project>\node_modules\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:73325:35)
    at Interface.<anonymous> (c:\Entwicklung\<Project>\node_modules\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:74477:27)
    at emitOne (events.js:96:13)
    at Interface.emit (events.js:188:7)
    at Interface._onLine (readline.js:232:10)
    at Interface.<anonymous> (readline.js:365:12)
```
The project uses TypeScript 2.2.1 and Visual Studio Code has been configured to use the workspace version of TypeScript instead of the built-in version. The identical project worked with yesterdays Insiders build and still works with the current stable build. Switching from the Workspace TypeScript to the built-in TypeScript fixes the issue as well.
`

data.title: Markdown Preview does not preserve scroll position
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a Markdown file.
2. Open the preview (ctrl+shift+v).
3. Close the Markdown file tab (not the preview).
4. Scroll a few times in the preview tab.
5. Open any other file.
6. Go to the preview tab again. Notice that the scrollbar is reset to top.

My suggestion is that the scroll position of Markdown preview tab should follow its corresponding raw Markdown tab's only if the raw Markdown tab is present. If it is not present, the preview tab should preserve the last scroll position.

|indenticator|SirTori|0.2.1|
|theme-visualstudio|none|0.0.1|
|theme-visualstudio-2016|none|0.0.1|
|tmlanguage|Togusa09|0.7.1|
|editorconfig-vscode-snippet|zgudino|0.2.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Turn wordwrap off in settings ("editor.wordWrap": "off")
2. Paste a very long link into a new document (https://thisisaverylonglink.com/abc[sb]=aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa)
3. Enable word wrap by pressing Alt-Z (or "View" -> "Toggle word wrap"). The link should be wrapped to two lines.
4. Open another document in a tab.
5. Switch back to the document with the link

The link is now unwrapped again.

Expected:
The word wrap setting is persisted when switching between tabs.

data.title: Edited color in gutter and scrollbar mismatch
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10
- OS Version: MacOs Sierra

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open VSCode project with a git repo
2. Edit a file and add some new lines
3. Side gutter on left shows `green` line for changes made.
4. Same section on scrollbar shows `blue` color. 

**Expected:**
Color on scrollbar should be green too

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1018196/24183255/76a6a1c0-0e84-11e7-8bd6-f1ccaa46f108.png)
